record.dc:title: 10-146 John Ausmus Farm Site 2CE10, Claiborne County, Tennessee. Mound 1. Feature 9, Area of ash and midden material.
record.wpa:narrative: The area from which these artifacts were taken was covered with burnt logs. These were embedded in ash and midden material. Three or four of the logs were uncovered for a length of three or four feet. They took no definite alignment. Another burnt log was encountered in Square 10.8 at the same level as those in Square 11.8. Squares 12.9, 11.9, 12.8 and 11.8 yielded an immense amount of potsherds. The original humus line which was quite distinct to the west melted away gradually between .10 and .9 into the midden material in which these artifacts were found. No floor line showed up on any of the walls to indicate the presence of a structure to which the burnt logs might have belonged. Neither do the postmolds in this area outline a structure. (See base chart- also profiles 10.0 and 11.0).
